WPc7qbWm.title: Reduced graphene oxide aerogel with high-rate supercapacitive performance in aqueous electrolytes.
WPc7qbWm.abstract: Reduced graphene oxide aerogel (RGOA) is synthesized successfully through a simultaneous self-assembly and reduction process using hypophosphorous acid and I2 as reductant. Nitrogen sorption analysis shows that the Brunauer-Emmett-Teller surface area of RGOA could reach as high as 830 m2 g-1, which is the largest value ever reported for graphene-based aerogels obtained through the simultaneous self-assembly and reduction strategy. The as-prepared RGOA is characterized by a variety of means such as scanning electron microscopy, transmission electron microscopy, X-ray diffraction, Raman spectroscopy, and X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy. Electrochemical tests show that RGOA exhibits a high-rate supercapacitive performance in aqueous electrolytes. The specific capacitance of RGOA is calculated to be 211.8 and 278.6 F g-1 in KOH and H2SO4 electrolytes, respectively. The perfect supercapacitive performance of RGOA is ascribed to its three-dimensional structure and the existence of oxygen-containing groups.

vkbRRbkV.title: Preparation of Microporous Carbon Using a Zeolite HY Template and Its Capacitive Performance
vkbRRbkV.abstract: Several microporous carbons were prepared by polyfurfuryl alcohol-impregnation and impregnation-acetonitrile chemical vapor deposition (CVD) using zeolite HY as a template,denoted as PFA carbons and AN carbons,respectively.These were used as electrode materials for supercapacitors.X-ray diffraction (XRD) patterns show that the structural regularity of the zeolite was well-replicated by the carbon structures prepared by impregnation-CVD.X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) confirmed that the AN carbons possess abundant nitrogen-containing groups because of the CVD of acetonitrile.The prepared carbons were typical microporous materials as determined by N2 adsorption/desorption test and they had a high BET surface area and narrow pore size distribution.Electrochemical tests showed that the AN carbons had higher capacitance because of their evident pseudo-capacitance from the nitrogen-containing groups.AN8 had a high capacitance up to 210 F · g-1.The capacitance retention ratio of the AN carbons were determined to its electric conductivity and mesoporosity.

uojWtnYU.title: Mesoporous carbons derived from citrates for use in electrochemical capacitors
uojWtnYU.abstract: Two mesoporous carbons were prepared by simple pyrolysis of commercial magnesium or barium citrate and tested as electrode materials for electrochemical double-layer capacitors(EDLCs),denoted MgC and BaC,respectively.The as-prepared carbon materials were characterized by N2 adsorption,scanning electron microscopy and Fourier transform infrared spectrometry.Nitrogen adsorption measurements demonstrated that the porosity of the prepared carbons was related to the type of metal cation.BaC possesses a typical bimodal pore size distribution(PSD)at 3.8 and about 15nm,while MgC was between small-size mesoporous and microporous.The carbons were tested as electrode materials using different electrochemical means such as cyclic voltammetry and constant current charge-discharge.Very high specific capacitance(180F·g-1 for MgC and 171F·g-1 for BaC)was achieved in an ionic liquid electrolyte.BaC proved to be an excellent electrode material with a high rate performance for EDLC application and exhibited an energy density up to 53.3Wh·kg-1 and a high maximum specific power density of 20kW·kg-1 in IL electrolyte.The good capacitive performance of BaC is attributed to its bimodal PSD and hydrophilic surface properties.

p5mKBiHR.title: Capacitive Performance of Tunable Ordered Mesoporous Carbons in Organic and H_2SO_4 Electrolytes
p5mKBiHR.abstract: Ordered mesoporous carbon materials were prepared by doping boric acid using a hard- templating method. The capacitive performance of these carbons was investigated in organic and H2SO4 electrolytes. As demonstrated by structure analysis the prepared carbons possessed parallel mesoporous channels. The pore size increased from 3.3 to 5.7 nm and the molar fraction of oxygenated groups on the carbon surface increased from 2.0% to 5.2% with an increase in the amount of boric acid doping from 0 to 50% (molar fraction). In the organic electrolyte, the carbons mainly showed typical electric double layer capacitive performance and no visible pseudo-capacitance was induced. In H2SO4 electrolytes, BOMC-5 showed the highest specific mass capacitance of 140.9 F·g-1 and the specific surface capacitance of the prepared carbons increased with an increase in the oxygenated groups and this carbon showed visible pseudo-capacitance because of the rapid redox reactions of the oxygenated groups. The capacitance retention ratio depends on the surface chemical properties, which determines the wettability of the carbon surface and the electrolytes.

g6pqrCCc.title: Research on regulation of pore structure of silica with hydrothermal method
g6pqrCCc.abstract: Silica nanoparticles were synthesized from water-glass by a simple sol-gel method.The influences of different hydrothermal temperatures(60℃,100℃,130℃,160℃,200℃) on the pore structure of silica nanoparticles were studied systematically.The as-prepared samples were characterized by a variety of means such as XRD,FT-IR,transmission electron microscopy(TEM) and N2 adsorption.The results indicate that the products are amorphous silica.The hydrothermal treatment can somehow change the surface chemical properties of silica.The hydrothermal treatment is an effective method in tailoring the pore structure and micro-topography of silica nanoparticles.

jQK5PNBh.title: Oxygen-containing functional group-facilitated CO2 capture by carbide-derived carbons.
jQK5PNBh.abstract: A series of carbide-derived carbons (CDCs) with different surface oxygen contents were prepared from TiC powder by chlorination and followed by HNO3 oxidation. The CDCs were characterized systematically by a variety of means such as Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy, X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy, ultimate analysis, energy dispersive spectroscopy, N2 adsorption, and transmission electron microscopy. CO2 adsorption measurements showed that the oxidation process led to an increase in CO2 adsorption capacity of the porous carbons. Structural characterizations indicated that the adsorbability of the CDCs is not directly associated with its microporosity and specific surface area. As evidenced by elemental analysis, X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy, and energy dispersive spectroscopy, the adsorbability of the CDCs has a linear correlation with their surface oxygen content. The adsorption mechanism was studied using quantum chemical calculation. It is found that the introduction of O atoms into the carbon surface facilitates the hydrogen bonding interactions between the carbon surface and CO2 molecules. This new finding demonstrated that not only the basic N-containing groups but also the acidic O-containing groups can enhance the CO2 adsorbability of porous carbon, thus providing a new approach to design porous materials with superior CO2 adsorption capacity.

fj26indb.title: Preparation of Mesoporous Carbons from Metal Organic Salt and Their Electrochemical Performances
fj26indb.abstract: Mesoporous carbon electrode materials were prepared directly from pyrolysis of EDTA calcium.N2 adsorption tests show that the carbons are typical mesoporous materials and the specific surface area of the carbons increases with the rise of carbonization temperature and the average pore size first increases and then decreases.Electrochemical tests demonstrate that CaC-700,CaC-800 and CaC-900 possess good capacitive behavior and they can maintain high energy density at high output power,at which their mesopore surface are utilized efficiently.It is believed that these carbons are very promising for the occasion where both high energy density and high output power are required.

YHie23Nr.title: Ordered mesoporous carbons with tunable pore size: Preparation and electrochemical applications
YHie23Nr.abstract: Boron-doped ordered mesoporous carbons (OMCs) with tunable pore size were prepared using SBA-15 as hard template and boric acid as pore expanding agent. As demonstrated by N 2 adsorption tests, the pore size increases from 3.3 to 8.1 nm with increasing in molar ratio of boric acid (0%∼75%), while the mesopore structure is retained. Electrochemical tests demonstrate that the Boron-doped OMCs present higher specific capacitance than the Boron-free OMC in KOH electrolyte. The capacitive performance is related to both pore regularity and pore size. The OMC prepared by doping 50% mole of boric acid shows the best capacitive performance.

sjyUcsQx.title: Bagasse-based Nanoporous Carbon for Supercapacitor Application
sjyUcsQx.abstract: A kind of nanoporous carbon has been successfully prepared from sugarcane bagasse through a facile microwave-induced ZnCl_2 activation and tested as electrode material in ionic liquid supercapacitor.The as-prepared nanoporous carbons are systematically characterized by a variety of means such as N_2 adsorption,SEM(scanning electron microscope) and TEM(transmission electron microscope).Characterization results reveal that the pore size of nanoporous carbons can be tuned from 2.5 nm to 7 nm by simply adjusting the concentration of ZnCl_2 solution from 20 wt%to 60 wt%.The nanoporous carbons are tested as electrode materials in ionic liquid using different electrochemical means such as cyclic voltammetry,constant current charge-discharge and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy. As evidenced by electrochemical measurements,the capacitive performances of the carbons are closely related to their pore sizes.It has been demonstrated that large pore size benefits the good capacitive performance of nanoporous carbon in ionic liquid electrolyte.

fHViHQkF.title: Electrochemical capacitive behaviors of mesoporous carbons from barium citrate
fHViHQkF.abstract: Mesoporous carbon electrode materials were prepared directly from pyrolysis of barium citrate. N 2 adsorption shows that the carbons prepared are typical mesoporous materials and that the specific surface area, total pore volume, mesopore volume and average pore size increase with the rise of carbonization temperature. Electrochemical measurements demonstrate that the carbons prepared at 700 and 800°C have superior capacitive performances than OMC prepared by hard-templated method. BaC-700 and BaC-800 could maintain high energy density at high power output, at which their mesopore surface are utilized efficiently. It is believed that these carbons are very promising for the scenarios where both high energy density and high power output are required.

wXjgQDhI.title: Synthesis of NaY zeolite using fluid catalytic cracking waste catalyst
wXjgQDhI.abstract: A method for reclaiming Fluid Catalytic Cracking (FCC) waste catalyst: was proposed. FCC waste catalyst was used as raw material for the synthesis of NaY zeolite from silica gel, sodium hydroxide and the directing(nucleation) agent via the hydrothermal method. For comparison purposes, the reference NaY zeolite was prepared using common industrial chemicals. The effect of FCC waste catalyst pretreatment on the performance of NaY zeolite was studied. It is found that Y zeolite synthesized using alkali activated FCC catalyst possesses high crystallinity and purity. Selected sample was characterized by XRD, N 2 adsorption-desorption techniques, TG-DTA method and temperature-programmed desorption of ammonium(NH 3-TPD). The results indicate that the NaY zeolite has similar performances to the reference zeolite and its surface area and pore volume can reach 615 m 2·g -1 and 0.38 cm 3·g -1 respectively.

pab2vc9Q.title: Preparation of Hierarchical Porous Carbon and Its Application in EDLC
pab2vc9Q.abstract: Hierarchical porous carbon was prepared by organic-organic self-assembly coupled with post-activation. As demonstrated by N2 adsorption tests,micropores were generated within the mesopore wall of MC via chemical activation,leading to dramatic increase of specific surface area. Compared to hard-templated ordered mesoporous carbon (OMC),HPC showed better electrochemical performances,which were ascribed to its unique micro-meso hierarchical porous structure that not only increases its surface area,but also decreases the diffusion resistance of electrolyte within the pore channels.

NJGAMHSx.title: Preparation and Study of Polyaniline/Biomass Carbon Composite and Its Capacitive Property
NJGAMHSx.abstract: Waste rice husk is treated under high-temperature carbonization condition to form porous carbon,and a composite electrode material is then prepared by coating polyaniline on this porous carbon substrate.BET,SEM and electrochemical test results show that the loaded polyaniline could have a significant effect on the surface morphology and structure of porous carbon.When the polyaniline loading is up to 50wt%,the porous carbon will be coated completely and the electrochemical properties of the composite will be improved greatly.The maximum specific capacitance is 308.7 F/g.
NJGAMHSx.venue: Journal of Kunming University of Science and Technology(Natural Science Edition)

Iv973Q4G.title: Sugarcane Bagasse-Based Activated Carbons Prepared by Microwave Activation and Its Electrochemical Capacitive Performance
Iv973Q4G.abstract: Two series of activated carbon materials had been successfully prepared by microwave activation and tube furnace heating treatment,for which sugarcane bagasse and ZnCl2 were used as carbon resource and activating agent respectively.The electrochemical capacitive performance of activated carbon prepared by microwave activation was studied in aqueous and ionic liquid electrolytes.Nitrogen sorption determination shows that the pore structure is closely related to the concentration of activating agent,and the activating method shows rarely effect on the pore structure,while the microwave activation possesses significant advantage in heating efficiency and homogeneity.Structural characterization reveals that the pore size of activated carbons could be tuned from 2.5 nm to 7.0 nm as the concentration of ZnCl2 solution increases from 20 wt% to 60 wt%.As evidenced by electrochemical measurements,the pore size plays a crucial role for the capacitive performance of activated carbons in ionic liquid electrolyte,and the larger the pore size,the better the capacitance.Ionic liquid supercapacitor could deliver much higher energy density than aqueous supercapacitor.AC60 could deliver 9.2 Wh/kg of energy density while maintaining 2.5 kW/kg of power density.

jyzFeukT.title: Synthesis and capacitive study of PANI/MWNTs composite material
jyzFeukT.abstract: The PANI/MWNTs composite material was synthesized by in-situ polymerization method using aniline and multiwall nanotubes(MWNTs) as raw materials.Polyaniline(PANI) was uniformly coated on the surface of the MWNTs.The electrochemical performances of the composite were tested by cyclic voltammetry and charge-discharge in 1mol/L H2SO4 solution using calomel as reference electrode.The results show that at the current density of 1A/g,the capacitance of the composite is up to 241.6F/g which is much higher than that of pure MWNTs value of 11.2F/g.

8pIZUcLi.title: SYNTHESIS,CHARACTERIZATION AND ELECTROCHEMICAL CHARACTERISTICS OF ORDERED CARBON NANOTUBES ARRAYS (OCNT)
8pIZUcLi.abstract: Ordered carbon nanotubes arrays (OCNT) were synthesized by templating method. The structure , morphology and electrochemical characteristics of OCNT were studied, using XRD, N2 adsorption, SEM,TEM,and cylic voltammogram. The results indicate that OCNT possess typical ordered mesoporous two-dimensional hexagonal structure(P6mm),1703m2/g specific surface area and narrow meso-pore size distribution,which the diameter is 3. 5nm. OCNT was composed of uniformly assembled carbon nanotubes. OCNT show excellent capacitance characteristics. The specific capacitance of OCNT declined only slightly even at high voltage scanning speed and it is 181. 2 F/g at 50mV/s. Even under high frequency OCNT maintain high specific capacitance and it is about 100F/g under 1Hz. Large pore size and orderefd pore structure may account for the excellent capacitance characteristics.

6Xfr3VeW.title: Preparation of graphene-based aerogels and their supercapacitive performance
6Xfr3VeW.abstract: A self-assembly method was adopted to synthesize graphene oxide aerogel(GOA),which was further reduced by hydrogen at 1 100 ℃ to obtain graphene aerogel(GA). Nitrogen adsorption analysis results show that both aerogels possess high BET surface areas(approximate 870 m2·g- 1). FT-IR analysis results reveal that the surface of GOA has more oxygen-containing groups than those of GA. Elemental results display that the C / O molar ratios of GOA and GA are 1. 7 and 69. 9,respectively. Electrochemical measurements show that at the current density of 0. 2 A·g- 1,the specific capacitance of GOA with high surface functionalized degree could reach up to 155. 8 F·g- 1,while GA with low surface functionalized degree exhibits a high-rate supercapacitive performance.
6Xfr3VeW.venue: Journal of China University of Petroleum(Edition of Natural Science)

wTyu74R4.title: N-doped microporous carbons derived from direct carbonization of K+ exchanged meta-aminophenol-formaldehyde resin for superior CO2 sorption.
wTyu74R4.abstract: N-doped microporous carbons with uniform ultramicropores (∼0.50 nm) are facilely prepared by direct carbonization of K(+) exchanged meta-aminophenol-formaldehyde resin. These materials give an unprecedented CO2 uptake of 1.67 mmol g(-1) at 25 °C and 0.15 bar and superior CO2-over-N2 selectivity (50 : 1).

tHibp9mu.title: Synthesis of High-Silica NaY Zeolite from Kaolin Based on Taguchi Technology
tHibp9mu.abstract: This paper reports a study of using Taguchi technology to find the optimum parameters for the synthesis of high-silica Y-zeolite from kaolinite.The effects of additional silica source,alkali,distilled water,and crystallization time on the synthesis of high Si/Al zeolite Y were investigated.The results show that the dosage of additional silica source(silica sol) and alkali are the most influential factors on the synthesis of high-silica Y zeolite.The optimum preparation conditions are that the molar composition of sodium aluminosilicate gel is 7.5SiO2:1.0Al2O3:2.2Na2O:120H2O,and crystallization time is 16 h.The NaY zeolite synthesized at optimized conditions was characterized by X-ray diffraction(XRD),N2 adsorption-desorption techniques and Scanning electron microscope(SEM).The characterization results indicate that the sample has higher Si/Al ratio and larger surface area than the reference Y zeolite sample.

h5czG9be.title: PBL teaching practice in biochemistry
h5czG9be.abstract: GMER(Global Minimal Essential Requirement) is the basic requirement for medical students nowadays.To improve the students' abilities in logical analysis,critical thinking and practical creativity,we adapt PBL approach in the course of biochemistry.Compared with the non-PBL students,the PBL students demonstrate an improved ability to study more independently, analyze the problems more logically and propose the solutions more rationally. The fact implies that this teaching model has a positive impact on improving the education quality.

QlgWdcrv.title: Evaluation of PBL teaching in biochemistry
QlgWdcrv.abstract: We applied the problem-based learning(PBL) approach to our biochemistry course in undergraduate students in order to prepare medical students in China to meet the basic requirements of GMER(global minimal essential requirement) and to train them to become qualified professionals in modern medicine and biology.At the end of the semester,we evaluated PBL teaching approach,including the analysis of examination results and student behavior(self-study motivation as well as their capabilities in problem identification,literature search,document organization,problem solving,and oral presentation).This PBL teaching practice provides useful information about teaching and training qualified medical students in current Chinese education system.

KnmU7pGE.title: The relationship of learning and memory damage by aluminum exposure with Ras/Raf/ERK and CREB signalmolecules
KnmU7pGE.abstract: Aluminum is one of the neuroviulence,has a great affinity with the brain tissue,accumulates in the central nervous system and causes chronic degenerative diseases of the nervous system. Hippocampus is a major target of aluminum accumulation in brain areas,and is learning and memory-related area. Aluminum affects neurologic functions through signal transduction molecules and transcription-related factors such as Ras/Raf/ERK(Ras/ERK) and CREB. Ras/Raf/ERK(Ras/ERK) pathway is related to learning and memory,CREB is involved in a variety of neural activities,including synaptic plasticity as well as learning and memory. In this article,we focus on the process that how aluminum exposure effects learning and memory and aluminum may affect the pathway of Ras/Raf/ERK and CREB.

r5u8FKEW.title: Aluminum Exposure Alters Long-term Potentiation and Expressions of Sodium Channels in Hippocampus
r5u8FKEW.abstract: Long-term potentiation (LTP) is a sustainable increase in the postsynaptic potential due to the rapidly repetitive stimulation applied in presynaptic neurons in a short period of time, which is considered as the basis for learning and memory formation. Sodium is one of the most important ions in the process of LTP induction, as the sodium influx causes a depolarization called the excitatory postsynaptic potential (EPSP). The high frequency stimuli causes the progressive depolarization of neurons as a result of EPSP summation, which relieves the magnesium blocked of the NMDA receptor, promotes the calcium influx and triggers the formation of LTP. Chronic aluminum exposure was reported to inhibit LTP induction and cut down LTP amplitude.The mRNA levels of 9 types of sodium channels, including Nav1.1-Nav1.9, have been analyzed by semi-quantitative RT-PCR from the rat hippocampal neurons.The results showed that 7 of the sodium channels were significantly increased (P<0.05) at mRNA levels following chronic aluminum exposure, except for Nav1.4 and Nav1.8. The protein expression of Nav 1.2(the brain-type sodium channel) was significantly increased by Western blot analysis. It was concluded that chronic aluminum exposure might impair the learning and memory function by altering the expressin of sodium channels, therefore, affecting the postsynaptic depolarization required for the induction of LTP.

cQQ9QDqT.title: Disturbance of intracellular calcium homeostasis and CaMKII/CREB signaling is associated with learning and memory impairments induced by chronic aluminum exposure.
cQQ9QDqT.abstract: Aluminum-induced neuronal injury has been implicated in various neurodegenerative disorders. However, the underlying mechanism involved in this pathogenesis still remains unknown. Our present findings demonstrated that chronic aluminum exposure resulted in spatial learning impairment and significantly increased intracellular calcium level in the hippocampus of rats. Examination of the associated protein molecules essential for induction and maintenance of long-term potentiation revealed that aluminum exposure could increase the expression level of calmodulin (CaM), but the expression levels of CaM-dependent protein kinase II (CaMKII), and phosphorylated cAMP-responsive element binding protein (CREB) were significantly reduced, whereas the total protein levels of CaMKII and CREB did not change in the aluminum-treated hippocampus. Thus, we provide a previously unrecognized mechanism whereby chronic aluminum exposure impairs hippocampal learning and memory, at least in part, through disruption of intracellular calcium homeostasis and CaM/CaMKII/CREB signaling pathway.

Vjx6P8hs.title: Effect of Aluminum Exposure on NMDA Receptors of Rat Hippocampus
Vjx6P8hs.abstract: Aluminum is one of the chronicity neurovirulence, effects many neurologic functions, especially for learning and memory inhibitory action. Aluminum can change nerve cell pellicula functions and N-methyl-D-Aspartate receptor (NMDA) to influence the calcium balance of cells to cause the cellular structure and functional disturbance, resulting in the different degrees of decline in the learning and memory capacity.NMDA receptor is one of the excitatory receptors of central glutamate, involves in the synaptic plasticity and the long-term enhancement of the cortex and hippocampus ,and plays important roles in opening of learning and memory functions and neuron plasticity and development of cerebrum.

uf9UAxw0.title: Effect of chronic aluminum exposure on LTP in area CA1 and the activity of α-CaMKⅡ in hippocampus of rat
uf9UAxw0.abstract: Objective:To investigate the effect of chronic aluminum exposure on Long term potentiation(LTP) in area CA1 and α-Ca2+/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase II(α-CaM KⅡ) activity in vivo.Methods:A stimulus bipolar electrode was placed in the CA3 area,with extra cellar microelectrode recording the population spike(PS) in CA1,and we observed the changes of PS amplitude before and after the high frequency stimulation(HFS) of lower,mid and higher level aluminum exposure groups and the control group,respectively.The α-CaMKⅡ activity was determined with Western blot by using phosphorylated antibody.Results:PS amplitude after HFS of the aluminum treated groups are significantly lower than that of control group(P < 0.01).The activity of CaMKⅡ in the aluminum-exposed groups is significantly lower than that in the control group(P < 0.01).Conclusion:Chronic aluminum exposure can inhibit the formation of LTP in vivo,and the decreased α-CaMKⅡ activity may play important role in this inhibition.

bqQ2SMlT.title: Effect of chronic aluminium exposure on cognitive ability and MAPK activity in rat hippocampus
bqQ2SMlT.abstract: Objective:To explore the mechanism of the impairments of longterm potentiation(LTP)and learning and memory function induced by chronic aluminum exposure by detecting the activity of mitogen-activated protein kinase(MAPK)in rats.Methods:The ablactated Wistar rats were fed with different concentrations of AlCl3 in the drinking water.The cognitive ability and and the activity of MAPK in rat hippocampus were determined by diving tower method and modified Takai method 3 months later,respectively.Results:The levels of aluminum in the blood and brains of rats exposed to different concentrations of AlCl3 were significantly higher than those in control subjects(P<0.01).Compared with control subjects,the latent period was significantly shorter and the activity of MAPK significantly lower in rats exposed to different concentrations of AlCl3(P<0.01,P<0.05).Conclusion:Chronic aluminum exposure can not only increase the concentration of aluminum in blood and brains but also reduce the activity of MAPK,so it may impair the cognitive ability in rats.

snC3nK16.title: Correlation between the activity of PKC,MAPK and LTP in the hippocampus of rats chronically exposed to aluminium
snC3nK16.abstract: Objective In this research,we have observed changes of the activities of PKC and MAPK,and their regulatory roles in changing the amplitude value of LTP due to aluminium exposure so that we can discuss the impact on the learning and memory that caused by the changed activities of PKC and MAPK due to chronic aluminium exposure.Methods 80 Delactosed wistar rats were divided into 4 groups.The rats drank water containing different doses of aluminium chloride(AlCl_3)(0,2,4,6 g/L respectively) for 3 m.Measured the LTP in hippocampus and determined the activities of PKC & MAPK with improved Takai method.Results AlCl_3 exposure could inhibit both PKC and MAPK in dose-dependent manner.For MAPK,the multiple of specific activity for each group was respectively 3.43±0.91,2.53±1.21 and 2.64±0.55(P<0.05);For PKC in cytoplasm,the multiple of specific activity for each group was respectively 4.95±0.76,5.31±0.90 and 5.50±1.46(P<0.01);For PKC in cytolemma,the multiple of specific activity for each group was separately 9.84±3.84,8.35±2.32 and 7.56±2.06(P<0.01).Conclusions Chronic aluminium exposure can reduce the amplitude value of LTP in hippocampus of rats and adjust the activities of PKC and ERK downwards.

YfBSp8K2.title: The effects of basic fibroblast growth factor on protein kinase B activity
YfBSp8K2.abstract: Objective: To study the effects of basic fibroblast growth factor(bFGF) on protein kinase B(PKB) activity. Methods: The cytosol and membrane activity of PKB at the indicated time periods was determined by [γ-32 P] ATP incorporation assay. Results: Both membrane and cytosol activity of PKB in HEK293 cell treated with bFGF (75 μg/L) reached to the peak at 10 min. Wortmannin efficiently inhibited the activity of PKB in HEK293 cell. Conclusion: b FGF rapidly stimulats both membrane and cytosol activity of PKB via P13K in HEK293 cell.

dezLlG6d.title: Effects of maternal chronic aluminum exposure on memorial behaviour and hippocampal intracellular Ca~(2+) concentration on their offspring
dezLlG6d.abstract: Aim To investigate the effects of maternal chronic aluminum exposure on memorial behaviour and hippocampal intracellular Ca2+ concentration ([Ca2+]i)on their offspring after the induction of LTP(long-term potentiation). Methods Adult Wistar rats (150~200 g) were exposed to aluminum by drinking distilled water, the concentration of AlCl3 is 0.015 mol·L-1(2 g·L-1) and 0.03 mol·L-1(4 g·L-1) aluminum chloride (AlCl3) solution, respectively, for 30 days prior to mating and during the whole gestation and suckling period. Their offspring were distributed into three experimental groups: control group; two exposed groups (represented by 0.2%-Al and 0.4%-Al ) administrated aluminum exposure ended at postnatal day 21. The brain tissue and blood aluminum levels were measured by Atomic absorption spectrometry (AAS). Memorial ability of the offspring was tested by Step down test.[Ca2+]i was measured by the technique of Fura-2/AM calcium ions fluorescence indicator. Results The mean aluminum content in blood and brain tissue was significantly higher than the control group(P<0.05 or P<0.01). The latencies of step down was significantly decreased, however, the error times of step down was significantly increased in the Al3+ exposed groups (P<0.01) as compared to the control group. The [Ca2+]i reduced in 0.2%-Al exposed group as well as 0.4%-Al exposed group. However, this reduction in 0.2%-Al exposed group was statistically non-significant(P>0.05), but was significantly decreased in 0.4%-Al exposed group(P<0.01). Conclusion Aluminum exposure of maternal rats impaired the memorial behaviour of the offspring, this impairment might be related to the decrease in [Ca2+]i caused by the aluminum exposure.

cS6izjeY.title: Effect of chronic aluminum exposure on [Ca~(2+)]_i and CaMKⅡ expression in hippocampus
cS6izjeY.abstract: Objective To go deep into the mechanism for chronic aluminum-induced impairments to learning and memory by studying the change of [Ca~ 2+]_i and concentration of calcium([Ca~ 2+]_i)calcium/calmodulin-dependent kinase Ⅱ(CaMKⅡ).Methods The ablactated Wistar rats were used to establish the chronic-aluminium exposed models by the gavages of aluminum chloride(AlCl_3)of different concentrations in the drinking water and measured the [Ca~ 2+]_i in hippocampi of the rats.Western Blot was used to determine CaMKⅡ contents in hippocampi.Results(1)[Ca~ 2+]_i in AlCl_3 exposed groups was obviously lower than that in control group(P<0.01)but there was no significant difference among aluminum treated groups.(2)The content of CaMKⅡ in hippocampus of AlCl_3-exposed groups fell down in a dose-dependent manner comparing with that of control group(P<0.01).Conclusion Chronic aluminum exposure can affect [Ca~ 2+]_i and CaMKⅡ content,which play most important roles in learning and memory,and impair the ability of learning and memory.

lLuRErKs.title: Effects of chronic aluminum exposure on protein and mRNA expression of ERK2/CREB pathway in hippocampus of rats
lLuRErKs.abstract: Objective To investigate the effects of chronic aluminum(Al) exposure on learning and memory function of rats by observing the changes of ERK2/CREB signaling pathway.Methods Eighty weaned Wistar rats were randomly divided into four groups,20 rats in each group.The four groups were fed with drinking water containing 0(control),2,4 and 6 mg/ml(Al exposure) AlCl3 for 3 consecutive months respectively to set up aluminum exposure models.Graphite furnace atomic absorption spectrometry was used to detect the content of Al in brain and blood.Western blot and real-time PCR(RT-PCR) were used to determine the protein and mRNA expression levels for ERK2 and CREB.Results Chronic Al exposure increased the content of Al in rats’ blood and brain.ERK2 and CREB expressions were decreased compared with the control in a dose-dependent manner(P<0.05).Conclusion Chronic Al exposure may affect learning and memory through impacting on ERK2/CREB signal pathway.

LcLt88bc.title: Effect of Chronic Aluminum Exposure on PKC,CaMK Ⅱ and Neurogranin in Hippocampus of Rat
LcLt88bc.abstract: To investigate the mechanism of aluminum-induced impairments to learning and memory, the effects of chronic aluminum exposure on long term potentiation (LTP) were studied. The activity of protein kinase C (PKC) was determined and the Effect of aluminum on protein expressions of Ca2+/calmodulin dependent protein kinase Ⅱ (CaMKⅡ) and neurogranin (Ng) were detected. The ablactated Wistar rats were used to establish the chronic aluminium exposure models by the gavage of AlCl_3 of different concentrations in the drinking water. And 3 months later, the concentrations of aluminum in brain and blood were measured, PS(population spilke) LTP in hippocampus of the rat was recorded, and then the activity of PKC was determined by modified Takai Method. Western blotting was used to determine the protein expressions of CaMKⅡ and Ng in hippocampus. The PKC activity of AlCl_3 exposure groups is obviously lower than that of control groups (P<0.01). The protein expression of Ng in the hippocampi of AlCl_3-exposure groups falls down comparing with that of control groups in a dose dependent manner (P<0.05).The protein expression of CaMKⅡ in the hippocampi of AlCl_3-exposure groups is lower than that of control groups in a dose dependent manner too (P<0.05). Chronic aluminum exposure can reduce not only the activity of PKC but also the protein expressions of CaMKⅡ and Ng and the phosphorylation level of Ng, thus affecting the affinity between Ng and calmodulin (CaM). The adjustment and modulation of Ca2+-CaM complex to CaMKⅡ were also impacted, inhibiting the formation of LTP and damaging learning and memory.

pLK5j4Iy.title: Effects of chronic aluminum exposure from prenatal to postnatal on learning and memory,NO,nNOS in hippocampus of young rats
pLK5j4Iy.abstract: Aim To study the change of NO and nNOS in hippocampus of young rats after chronic aluminum exposure of different concentration from prenatal to postnatal period,to go deep into the synaptic mechanism of that aluminum impairs learning and memory capacity.Methods Rats of control,low-dose and high-dose groups were treated from gestation with distilled water and AlCl3 water solution with concentration of 15 mmol·L-1 and 30 mmol·L-1 Al3+ respectively.The aluminum concentrations of brain and blood were measured by Atomic absorption spectrometry(AAS).The step-down test was used to monitor the learning and memory ability.The content of NO was tested by nitrate reductase method.The expression of nNOS positive cells were observed with immunohistochemistry.Results Compared with the control group,in the Al3+ exposed groups,the blood and brain aluminum were significantly higher,the ability of learning and memory remarkably decreased,the hippocampal intracellular NO content was obviously reduced,the nNOS positive cells in the CA1 and CA3 region of hippocampus significantly decreased.Conclusions Aluminum exposure from prenatal to postnatal impaired the learning and memory ability of young rats,and the impairment might be related to the decrease of intracellular NO content and the expression of nNOS positive cells in hippocampus.

DB23odao.abstract: The paper analyzes current research results of IDSS and researches the intelligent decision support system(IDSS).According to the development process and characteristics of IDSS,the paper integrates the MVC design pattern method in Web development and uses expert system(ES),the data Warehouse(DW),online analytical processing(OLAP) and data mining(DM) technology therefore,and presents a structural framework to synthesize IDSS,which is divided into four levels.Furthermore,the paper describes the role of all levels.

pYN8JeS7.title: A Fast Moving Object Extraction Method based on H.264 Compressed Video
pYN8JeS7.abstract: For the purpose of extracting moving object from H.264 compressed video,a extracting moving method based on Fisher criterion is presented.Firstly,the paper retrives the moving vectors(MV) of sub block in the Macro Block(MB) which was 16x16 pixels in P frame,and the moving vector of each sub block is weighted in each MB.The each moving vector of the same MB is also weighted in the inter frames.Finally,the weighted moving vector of each MB is retrived from the P frame and is judged by the Fisher criterion.The experimental results show that the proposed approach can quickly extract moving object from H.264 compressed video,which guarantees extracting quality.
keywords: Fisher Criterion: H.264 Compressed Video: Motion Vector Field

lP5rdTAq.title: Frame of development of projects in telecommunications applications
lP5rdTAq.abstract: Telecommunications projects are complex,large and rapidly changing,but telecom operators require compress the software development cycle for the purpose of seizing the market opportunities.In order to develop a stable software system of the telecommunications project efficiently,high-quality in a short period,use the framework-based software development approach is the best option. In this article,the concept and the characteristics of frame are briefly introduced,and then some applications of the frame in telecommunications project are summarized.

cGqQCQAZ.title: Application of pipe humidifying technology at kiln back end in 5 000 t/d clinker production line
cGqQCQAZ.abstract: In the new dry process cement plant's firing system, humidifier tower is usually adopted in flue gas conditioning treatment of high temperature dust gas. Sinoma International Engineering Co.,Ltd. first used double-fluid pipeline spraying system substituting for humidifier tower in the klind-back-end gas conditioning treatment of Xinjiang Yili Tianshan 5 000 t/d clinker production line project,and the process scheme and design of the spraying system were introduced in detail. At present,the production line has been put into operation for 2 years, the running is normal and the flue gas treatment reaches standard.

rtxobqsA.title: The Research of QVT Model Transformation Approaches
rtxobqsA.abstract: Model transformation is one of the most important part of MDA,the performance of the quality have a direct influence on the software development work.This paper introduces the theory knowledge of model,computation independent model,platform independent model,platform specific model,model transformation and transformation rules.Then through the research of the relatively popular model transformation approaches,such as direct transformation approaches,the transformation approaches based on the relational algebra and the transformation approaches based on the mappings between the metamodel etc,the paper also analyzes their existing deficiency and puts forward the QVT model transformation approaches.The results of the study show that the approaches of this paper have a great advantage of performance.

QdS5qbir.title: Key Technology Research of Unified Management Platform based on the Business of Marketing Case
QdS5qbir.abstract: In the development of the telecommunications,the most important problem the carrier faced is how to attract the new cus-tomers and keep the original ones.The marketing case is a main method used by carriers,which attracts fresh and old customers by giving presented calls and retains customers by the execution cycle of the marketing cases.Along with the development of society,the competitive relationships between the carriers are intensified incessantly,and the marketing case gradually becomes diversified and personalized.In order to meet the requirement of the continuous development of the marketing case,the integral and unified planning and implement for the mar-keting case is needed to be addressed urgently.It’s imperative to build a kind of unified,efficient and configurable platform which can meet the requirement of marketing case to make up the problems of overhead maintenance,a long development cycle and insufficient single of the existed ones.

vBcBehEp.title: Research of Model Transformation Approaches Based on Finite State Machine
vBcBehEp.abstract: Model transformation is one of the most important parts of MDA,therefore,the research of the approach of model transformation is very important.To promote the development of the theory of MDA framework and explore the more effective model transformation mechanism,it does a more in-depth research for the approach of model transformation.Introduce the classification of finite state machine and the work principle of it,and use the theory of finite state machine to the model transformation,thus put forward the model transformation approaches based on finite state machine.Analyse and research the model transformation approaches based on finite state machine from the following several aspects in-depth,mainly including the definition of transformation metamodel,the finite state machine description at the model transformation and the state generation algorithm of enabled reverse operation.The approach in this paper for the model of a more obvious change status transformation between them provides a more convenient model transformation plan,at the same time for the other approach of model transformation has some reference value.

x1NyEULi.title: Realization of photograph class object in Word document's auto marking paper in testing system
x1NyEULi.abstract: As the increasingly development of network technology,the examinations are more often taken on computers,instead of using paper.For instance,Word Manipulating Test is such a kind of test which requires much more operations and manipulations.In recent years,people have achieved many improvements in auto marking paper.However,actual test styles are limited and are only restricted in several simple operations on Word or Excel tests.In the contrary,the manipulations on complicated photographs are hardly realized.In this paper,function modules of the information technology examination system are introduced first,while the solutions of auto marking paper are also recommended here.The solutions are able to check up any type of Office files accurately and intelligently,and work out the total grade afterward.At the end of this paper,the method of using complex photograph object to realize auto marking paper is introduced.

uBmqUltw.title: A Moving Object Extraction Method in H. 264 Compressed Domain Based on Kernel Clustering
uBmqUltw.abstract: In this paper,a moving object extraction method in H. 264 compressed domain based on kernel clustering is proposed. First,the motion vector is normalized. Second,the median filter using Average Euclidean Distance is used to process noise for motion vector.Third,the clustering center is initialized by the subtractive clustering and the use the fuzzy clustering to classify the data. Finally,the extracted condition is produced by the valid function and the moving object is got adaptively by the divided condition. The Hall experiment results show that the method can get the moving object very well.

FakoIZ65.title: Study on microbial community in methanogenic granular sludge by FISH and DGGE
FakoIZ65.abstract: Four methanogenic granules taken from an anaerobic reactor in different periods were investigated by FISH and DGGE, the eubacterial and archaeal community in these granules was researched and the phylogenetic analysis of dominant archaea was also studied. The FISH results indicated that the quantity of eubacteria was much more than archaea in the methanogenic granule and most eubacteria were located in the out layer of granule, while most archaea were located in the inner layer. The DGGE fingerprints indicated that as the organic loading rate of the reactor increased and the operating time elapsed, the eubacterial community was kept stable relatively, while the archaeal community was changed significantly, which resulted in the gradual decrease of the archaeal varieties. As seven typical bands were cut and sequenced, the results indicated that the dominant species of archaea in granule of the last period were Methanocor pusculum, Methanobacterium, Methanosaeta, and etc.

6XxeT6vc.title: Microbial community in granules from an EGSB reactor operated at 20 degrees C]
6XxeT6vc.abstract: The microbial communities in 6 granular sludge samples taken from a lab-scale EGSB reactor operated under different organic loading rates (OLR) at 20 degrees C were studied using PCR-DGGE and RTQ-PCR technique. The results indicate that as the OLR increased from 1.5 kg/(m3 x d) to 10.0 kg/(m3 x d), the microbial communities of archaea and eubacteria in the 6 sludge samples are not changed greatly. The archaea population is highly similar among the 6 samples. The Shannon indexes of archaea population are 5.51, 5.88, 5.47, 5.25, 5.32 and 5.11, respectively. Except the seed sludge, the eubacteria population is similar among the other 5 samples. The Shannon indexes of eubacteria population are 2.97, 5.07, 5.44, 6.38, 6.66 and 5.21, respectively. The dominant archaea in the 6 granular samples are Methanobacterium, Methanocorpusculum, Methanosaeta and Methanospirillum. As the OLR of the reactor increased and the operation time elapsed, Methanocorpusculum parvum and Methanospirillum hungatei, both are hydrotrophic methanogens, become the dominant archaea. The archaea content in the samples decreases slightly at the beginning, but increases later and finally reaches to a level obviously higher than that in the seed sludge.

kt1bhbU9.title: Psychrophilic methanogens and their application in anaerobic wastewater treatment]
kt1bhbU9.abstract: Psychrophiic methanogens play a very important role in global carbon cycle, and attract more and more research interests. The application of psychrophilic methanogens in anaerobic biotreatment process could essentially break through the bottle-neck of anaerobic technology at lower temperature, greatly extend the application fields of anaerobic technology, and reduce the operational cost of wastewater treatment. In this paper, the research progress on psychrophilic methanogens was reviewed, with the focus on their culture, isolation, physiological and biochemical characters, molecular biological characters, and cold-adapted mechanisms. The application prospects of psychrophilic methanogens in low-temperature anaerobic bio-treatment technology were also analyzed.

6mWRCx6O.title: Laws, Policies and Technologies For Stormwater Management in Europe
6mWRCx6O.abstract: The European Water Framework(2000/60/EC) demands the improvement of chemical and ecological status of water bodies,and stormwater management is indispensable in order to reach its objectives.This paper makes a summary of the laws,policies and technologies of the stormwater management in EU countries.It is composed of three parts.The first part talks about the main Directives adapted by EU that involves stormwater management;the second part talks about the policies and technologies used by EU countries for stormwater treatment,more focus are taken to analyze the policy of stormwater fee,the drainage system and the best management practices(BMPs) in Europe;the third part has a comparable analysis about present states of the stormwater management in Germany and Greece.The former is one of the best countries carrying stormwater management and the latter hasn't paid much attention on stormwater yet.

yTShcDnX.title: Diversity and quantity of different microorganisms in methanogenic granular sludge
yTShcDnX.abstract: PCR-DGGE, FISH and RTQ-PCR techniques were used to study the microbial community structure and quantity of different microorganisms in the methanogenic granule in different phases from a lab-scale anaerobic reactor. The results indicated that as the organic loading rate of the reactor increasing, the archaea community changed more significantly than bacterial community. Most bacteria were located in the out layer of granule, while most archaea were located in the inner layer. The quantity of archaea was a little less than bacteria, and the quantity of methanosaeta increased significantly.

0G49Ejaf.title: Study on microbial community in anaerobic granular sludge by molecular technology
0G49Ejaf.abstract: The biodiversity,spatial distribution and quantification of different microbial species in the anaerobic methanogenic granules were investigated by FISH,RTQ-PCR,DGGE,and the phylogenetic analysis of dominant archaea were conducted.The results indicated that: most eubacteria were located in the surface area of the(granule),while most archaea were located in the inner layer;the quantity of archaea was less than eubacteria,but increased gradually;as the organic loading rate of the reactor increased and the operating time elapsed,the eubacterial community was kept relatively stable,while the archaeal community was changed significantly,which(resulted) in the gradual decrease of the archaeal varieties;in the end of the operation,the dominant species of(archaea) in this methanogenic granule were Methanocorpusculum,Methanobacterium,Methanosaeta,and etc.

tqvUwcpq.title: Performance and microbial characteristics of an EGSB reactor treating brewery wastewater under 20 degrees C]
tqvUwcpq.abstract: A lab-scale EGSB reactor fed by artificial brewery wastewater was operated under 20 degrees C continuously, and its process performance, characteristics of granular sludge, microbial community structure were investigated. The results indicated that: 1) after 184 days' operation, the organic loading rate of EGSB reactor could reach 10 kg/(m3 x d) at HRT of about 18 h, the COD removal efficiencies were above 85%, and the specific biogas production was about 0.58 m3 per kilogram COD removed. 2) As the organic loading rate increased, the average diameter of the granule increased, and the settling velocity increased too, but when the loading rate reached about 10 kg/(m3 x d), the granular average diameter decreased slightly. Compared with the granular sludge operated at mesophilic condition, the ECP contents especially the protein contents in the granular sludge operated at 20 degrees C increased obviously. 3) Compared with the seed sludge, the main Archaea (methanogenes) species in the sludge samples operated at different loading rates under 20 degrees C did not change greatly, but the dominant methanogenes in the sludge operated under 15 degrees C for 6 months seeded with the same mesophilic sludge changed obviously.

g6mUe6iM.title: Community structure of nitrification bacteria in aerobic short-cut nitrification granule
g6mUe6iM.abstract: By using a lab-scale aerated upflow sludge bed reactor, the inoculated anaerobic granule was cultivated to aerobic nitrification granule, and then converted to short-cut nitrification granule with the short-cut nitrification efficiencies above 90%. Appling real-time quantity PCR, and florescent in situ hybridization techniques, the ecological community structure of nitrification bacteria in aerobic granules were studied. The results show that there existed a layered structure in the aerobic granule, the ammonia oxidizing bacteria (AOB) was mainly located in the surface area of the granule, and the nitrite oxidizing bacteria (NOB) was mainly located in the inner area of the granule, was just adjacent to the AOB. There was no active bacteria in the inner core area. The amount of AOB in the granules increased, as the ammonia loading rate of the reactor was increased gradually. The percentages of AOB in the total amount of Eubacteria in the granule were 0.45%, 5.20%, 15.37%, 48.55% respectively, as the ammonia loading rates of the reactor were 0, 0.4, 1.0 and 2.2 kg/(m 3·d) respectively, and the nitrification efficiencies were 0%, 35%, 50%, 99% relatively.

WcxxL8pq.title: Continuous bio-hydrogen production by mesophilic and thermophilic cultures]
WcxxL8pq.abstract: Anaerobic biological hydrogen productions were achieved successfully in two lab-scale anaerobic hydrogen production reactors under mesophilic (37 degrees C) and thermophilic (55 degrees C) conditions, respectively. The mesophilic reactor, a CSTR, was operated over 4 months by seeding with river sediments and feeding with glucose solution, in which the highest hydrogen production rate was 8.6 L/(L x d) and the substrate hydrogen production molar ratio (H2/glucose) was 1.98. After seeded with anaerobic methanogenic granules, a UASB reactor was thermophilically operated by feeding with sucrose solution and during its steady operation period, the hydrogen production rate was 6.8 L/(L x d) and the substrate hydrogen production molar ratio (H2/sucrose) was 3.6. Within the produced gas, the H2 percentages were about 43% and others were CO2, no methane could be detected. Thermophilic hydrogen-producing granules were successfully cultivated in the UASB reactor, which were grey-white in color, the diameters were about 0.8 - 1.2 mm, and typical settling velocities were about 30 - 40 m/h. Through SEM a great number of bacilli could be found on the surface of the granules which made the surface rough. Total DNA of these two hydrogen production sludges were extracted and purified, and the PCR and DGGE process were conducted, the results indicate that most of the eubacteria in two sludges are the same, but the dominant species are obviously different with each other.

jlVp1Rp4.title: MRI Featyres and Analysis of Primary Central Nervous System Lymphoma(19 cases reported)
jlVp1Rp4.abstract: Objective The study was to assess the performance characteristics of brain lymphoma,and raise the awareness of the disease by retrospectively analyzing 19 cases of primary central nervous system lymphoma.Method 19 patients underwent sagittal,axial and coronal MRI scan and enhanced examination.Results In 19 patients(15 of them were solitary,4 were multiple),total 24 lesions were found.The lesions in the frontal lobe in 4 cases,temporal lobe in 6 cases basal ganglia in 7 cases,corpus callosum in 4 cases,parietal lobe in 1 case,cerebellum in 2 cases.Lesions in 11 cases mainly distributed in the cortex and subcortical,13 cases were located in deep white matter.Almost all lesions appeared as quasi-circular masses,which in the corpus callosum maybe look like "butterfly sign".In 19 cases the lesions signal is uniformity,in 5 cases small spots with long T1,T2 signal were seen.Homogeneous enhancement in 21cases,ring enhancement in 3 cases.Conclusion MRI examination for primary central nervous system lymphoma diagnosis is extremely important,and very helpful for clinical treatment.

FpsmoMXR.title: Evaluation of Cervical Lymph Nodes by Minimal ADC in Patients with Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma:A Preliminary Study
FpsmoMXR.abstract: Purpose:The aim of the study was to verify the efficacy of minimal apparent diffusion coefficient(ADCmin) in evaluating cervical lymph nodes.Methods:Imaging data of cervical lymph nodes in patients with poorly differentiated nasopharyngeal carcinoma(NPC) were analyzed retrospectively.According to the criteria that the smallest diameter was between 1.5 cm and 2.5 cm,all lymph nodes collected in this study were divided into non-radiotherapeutic group(31 lymph nodes) and radiotherapeutic group(16 lymph nodes).The smallest diameter and rate of centric necrosis were calculated.ADCminand mean ADC(ADCmean) of parenchyma in cervical lymph nodes were measured by ImageJ software on ADC image.Results:Between these two groups,the smallest diameters of lymph nodes were 2.23±0.24 cm and 2.14±0.44 cm respectively,which were with no significant difference(t=0.467,P>0.05);The rates of centric necrosis were 6.45% and 43.75% respectively,which were with significant difference(χ2=7.227,P<0.05);ADCminwas(0.417±0.083)×10-3mm2/s and(0.433±0.758)×10-3mm2/s respectively,which were with no significant difference(t=-0.667,P>0.05);ADCmeanwas(0.745±0.112)×10-3mm2/ s and(0.838±0.140)×10-3mm2/s respectively,which were with statistical difference(t=-2.467,P<0.05).Conclusion:ADCmin is different from ADCmean in assessing changes after radiotherapy,combined ADCmean with ADCmin may give more information for clinical treatment.

nRTRxrca.title: Research of the early changes of CT perfusion in advanced NSCLC recombinant human endostatin combined with chemotherapy
nRTRxrca.abstract: Objective To investigate early parameter changes of CT perfusion(CTP) in recombinant human endostatin(endostar) to treat advanced NSCLC(non small cell lung cancer).Methods 15 patients with advanced NSCLC were divided into the endostar group(9 cases) and the control group(6 cases).Two groups both underwent two times of CTP examination before the treatment and after the first circle of treatment.And perfusion parameters including BF and BV were calculated and CTP parameter changes before and after treatments were compared between two groups.Results After treatment,BF of the endostar group was lower than that after treatment(P=0.038<0.05).But for the control group,there is no statistical difference in CTP parameters before and after treatment.After treatment,the BF change ratio of the endostar group was higher than that of the control group(P=0.028<0.05).Conclusion CTP can find the hemodynamic changes after treatment of NSCLC by the antiangiogenic therapy.Treated by endosatin with chemotherapy,it can be embodied as BF rise.

OweTUEgx.title: MR Diffusion Tensor Imaging Study in Patients with Trigeminal Neuralgia Due to Neurovascular Compression
OweTUEgx.abstract: Purpose:To study the difference between bilateral trigeminal nerves in patients with trigeminal neuralgia(TN) caused by neurovascular compression on diffusion tensor imaging.Methods: Diffusion tensor images of sixteen patients(7 men and 9 women,aged 32~71) with TN,who were proven by surgery,were evaluated retrospectively.Thin axial images of intracisternal segment of the trigeminal nerve were acquired by 3D Space sequence.DTI was done with single shot EPI sequence by copying the location of 3D Space sequence.Mean and minimum FA values of the trigeminal nerve in TN–affected side and the contralateral side were measured respectively.Paired t test was used to compare the difference of mean and minimum FA values of the trigeminal nerve in TN–affected side and the contralateral side.Results: Mean and minimum FA values of the trigeminal nerve in TN–affected side were 0.249±0.06 and 0.199±0.07.Mean and minimum FA values of that in the contralateral side were 0.283±0.07 and 0.262±0.07.Significant differences of mean and minimum FA were present between the trigeminal nerves in TN–affected side and the contralateral side.Conclusion: DTI can quantify the abnormality of trigeminal neuralgia due to neurovascular compression,and it is useful for diagnosis.

n4Orj32Q.title: Functional MRI Studies of the Neural Mechanisms of Execution Control and Conflict Monitor on the Condition of Sustained Attention
n4Orj32Q.abstract: Purpose:To identify the neural mechanisms of execution control and conflict monitor on the condition of sustained attention with functional MRI.Methods:Sixteen right-handed healthy adults participated in the experiment which was designed with continues performance test.All fMRI data were analyzed by SPM2.Results:The right anterior cingulated cortex(ACC)and left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex(DLPFC)were activated.Cerebelum、caudate and putamen were engaged.Conclusion:The anterior cingulated cortex and dorsolateral prefrontal cortex are the basis of execution control and conflict monitor.The experiment supports the theory that dorsolateral prefrontal cortex may be the cortex of execution control and prompts that the execution control depending on the cooperation of cerebellum and striatum.

n6Gkuysu.title: The Combination of SWI with DTI in Diagnosis of Acute and Subacute Diffuse Axonal Injury
n6Gkuysu.abstract: Objective To investigate the significance of Susceptibility Weighted Imaging(SWI) combinated with Diffusion tensor Imaging(DTI) in Diagnosis of acute and subacute Diffuse Axonal Injury.Methods Nineteen acute or subacute DAI patients underwent SWI,DTI and conventional MRI sequence examination.The sensitivity of each sequence in displaying lesions was compared.To correlation between the number of lesions and initial glasgow coma score(GCS)was analyzed.Results The number of lesions detected were 128,279,538,589 respectively on T2WI,DTI,SWI and combination SWI with DTI.The number of lesions detected by SWI and DTI was statistical more than that by conventional sequence(Z=-3.764,Z=-3.245;P<0.01).The number of lesions detected by combination SWI with DTI was statistical more than that by DTI(Z=-3.551,P<0.01) or SWI(Z=-2.351,P<0.05).The number of lesions revealed by combination SWI with DTI was negatively correlated with GCS(r=-0.775,P<0.01).Conclusion Combination of SWI with DTI can display more DAI lesions than single SWI or single DTI,furthermore,can be used to estimate the condition of patients preferably.3D DTT may visual display the impaired fibers.
keywords: Susceptibility weighted imaging Tiffusion tensor imaging Diffuse axonal injury Glasgow coma scale

1BrsKKzN.title: MSCT Evaluation of Colonic Lesion by Pneumocolon
1BrsKKzN.abstract: Purpose:To evaluate the value of 64-slice CT in the examination of colonic lesion by pneumocolon. Methods:Fifty-seven patients with colonic lesions underwent MSCT and multiphase contrasted scanning with combining negative contrast agent filling the small intestine and pneumocolon. Contrasted MSCT scans were performed using 64-slices CT system 25 s (phase Ⅰ )、48-50 s (phase Ⅱ ) and 58 s(phase Ⅲ) after intravenous administration of contrast medium. Images were then obtained by CT virtual endoscopy (CTVE),multi-planar reformation (MPR),volume rendering(VR) on post-processing workstation.Results:The sensitivity ,specificity and accuracy were 93.3%,73.3% and 91.2%,respectively. Conclusion:The use of 64-slice CT in the examination of colonic lesion by pneumocolon can further improve the accuracy of qualitative diagnosis and localization diagnosis in colonic lesions.

cKjXRuwT.title: Differentiation between malignant and benign solitary pulmonary nodules: use of volume first-pass perfusion and combined with routine computed tomography.
cKjXRuwT.abstract: To evaluate the capability of first-pass volume perfusion computed tomography (PCT) for differentiation of solitary pulmonary nodules (SPNs) and to compare that of combination of PCT and routine CT with CT alone for the differentiation.Our institutional review board approved this study and informed consent was obtained. With nine excluded, 65 consecutive patients having a SPN with histopathologic proof or follow-up underwent a 30s PCT using the deconvolution model were evaluated. Kruskal-Wallis tests and receiver operating characteristics (ROC) analysis were underwent. Four radiologists assessed nodules independently and retrospectively. Diagnostic capability was compared for CT alone and PCT plus CT. ROC analysis, McNemar test, and weighted kappa statistics were performed.Significant differences were found in parameters between malignant and benign nodules (p<0.0001 for blood flow, blood volume, and permeability surface area product), SPNs were more likely to be malignant by using threshold values of more than 55 ml/100 g/min, 2.5 ml/100 g, and 10 ml/100 g/min, respectively. PCT plus CT was significantly better in overall sensitivity (93%, p=0.004) and accuracy (94%, p=0.003) compared to CT alone, not specificity (96%). Area under the curve for ROC analyses of PCT plus CT was significantly larger than that of CT alone (p=0.018). Mean weighted kappa for PCT plus CT was 0.715, that for CT alone was 0.447.Volume first-pass PCT can distinguish SPNs. Using PCT plus routine CT may be more sensitive and accurate for differentiating malignant from benign nodules than CT alone and allows more confidence and constancy.

qKDQ34Kw.title: Value of diffusion-weighted imaging in evaluating the afficacy of radiotherapy on metastasis lymph node in rabbit model with xenografts of VX2 tumor
qKDQ34Kw.abstract: Objective To study the value of diffusion-weighted imaging(DWI) in evaluating the afficacy of radiotherapy on metastasis lymph node in rabbit model with xenografts of VX2 tumor.Methods The VX2 tumor xenograft models were established into 17 New Zeland rabbits,which were divided in two groups of radiotherapy(10 rabbits) and control(7 rabbits).DWI and MRI were performed,respectively,before and on the 1st,3rd and 7th day after radiotherapy and the volumes and ADC values of the metastasis lymph nodes were measured.Results There were no significant differences at all time points in the changes of the size of metastasis lymph nodes between two groups(P>0.05).The ADC values on the 3rd and 7th day after radiotherapy were 1.267±0.20 and 1.688±0.33,which were significantly higher than 1.054±0.12 before and 1.040±0.17 on the 1st day after radiotherapy (P<0.01).Conclusion Compared to conventional MRI,DWI can reveal the early changes of metastasis lymph node after radiotherapy in rabbit model with xenografts of VX2 tumor.

xGBzWV20.title: CT diagnosis of inflammatory pseudotumor of spleen(report of 8 cases and literature review)
xGBzWV20.abstract: Objective:To investigate CT manifestations of inflammatory pseudotumor of the spleen and their diagnostic value. Methods:The clinical and CT data of 8 cases confirmed by surgery and pathology of inflammatory pseudotumor of the spleen were retrospectively analyzed and reviewed the CT appearances in combination with the literatures relevant to this disorder. Results:A total of 9 foci of 8 patients were showed low density in CT scan.Of these 9 fouci,7 presented with clear edge and 2 with slightly indistinct borders,in which the density of the bigger foci were uneven.2 foci were not enhanced obviously and 7 were a little enhanced during the arterial phase.While,8 foci were strengthened and the smaller foci were isodense in the portal venous phase. Conclusion:The dynamic enhanced CT on inflammatory pseudotumor of the spleen exhibits the characteristics in terms of continuity,progressive enhancement,and delayed enhancement,which is of great value in the diagnosis and differential diagnosis of inflammatory pseudotumor of the spleen.

GhkiNCM0.title: Diagnosis and Differential Diagnosis of Fallopian Tube Abscess
GhkiNCM0.abstract: purpose:To explore the CT findings and clinical manifestations in the diagnosis of fallopian tube abscess(FTA).Methods:Twenty-eight patients with pathological confirmed FTA were enrolled in our study.All the patients underwent contrast enhanced CT scans.The CT features of them were analyzed. Results:The tube sign of the fallopian tube were shown in 24 cases(85.7%),25%(6/24) of them were shown with smooth wall,and 75%(18/24) of them manifested coarse wall with apparent enhancement. Poorly defined complex masses in adnexa area with apparent enhancement were shown in 11cases(39.3%). Increase of fat density around rectum and before sacral were shown in 21 cases(75%).Fluid accumulation in pelvic cavity were shown in 27/28 cases(96.4%).And small bowel obstruction was shown in 1 case(3.6%). Conclusion:CT examination plays an important role in diagnosis of fallopian tube abscess and clinical evaluation.

Q7W6cENd.title: Value of susceptibility weighted imaging in detecting the intratumoral hemorrhage of rabbit VX2 renal carcinoma
Q7W6cENd.abstract: Objective To explore the value of susceptibility weighted imaging(SWI)in detecting the intratumoral hemorrhage of rabbit VX2renal carcinoma.Methods Rabbit VX2renal carcinoma model was established in 20 New Zealand rabbits,which underwent conventional MRI examination and SWI examination followed by pathological examination on the 21st day.The images of the conventional MRI and SWI were analyzed and the results were compared.Results One rabbit was excluded because of obvious artifacts.Twenty-eight renal xenografts were observed in 19rabbits.The incidence rate of intratumoral hemorrhage detected by conventional MRI was 75%(21/28),which was lower than 100%(28/28)by SWI(P<0.01).Conclusion Compared with conventional MRI,SWI displays better in detecting the intratumoral hemorrhage of rabbit VX2renal carcinoma.

oDlNzHzU.title: Study of MR Diffusion-weighted Imaging in Rabbit VX2 Metastatic Lymphadenopathy Models with Different b Values
oDlNzHzU.abstract: Purpose:To evaluate the difference of ADC values in VX2 metastatic lymphadenopathy models with different b values.Methods:Conventional MRI and DWI images were obtained from 40 rabbits,which were divided into two groups as lymphadenitis model and metastaic lymph node model. ADC values of lymph nodes with different b values (including 0～500 s/mm2 and 0～1000 s/mm2) were measured. The results of all ADC values were expressed as the average ± standard deviation,and were compared (paired t-test) between different groups and different b values. All lymph nodes were confirmed by pathology.Results:When low b values (0～500 s/mm2) were used,there was no statistical difference between the average ADCs of benign and malignant lymph nodes.There was statistical difference between them when high b values(0～1000s/mm2)were used(t=-3.298,P= 0.021).Conclusion:Diffusion-weighted imaging can reveal water diffusion in lesions more accurate with high b value.

d9uMzbD7.title: Value of 16-slice CT angiography in diagnosis and treatment of cerebral aneurysms
d9uMzbD7.abstract: Objective To assess the clinical value of 16-slice CT angiography (CTA) in diagnosis and treatment of cerebral aneurysms. Methods 382 patients were included in the study and successively underwent 16-slice CTA examination for suspected cere- bral aneurysms. Using maximum-intensity projections and volume-rendering techniques, two neuroradiologists performed the morphology, size and location of the aneurysms, neck geometry, and the relationship of aneurysms to bone structures and adjacent branch vessels. Sixteen-slice CTA images were used to determine whether the aneurysm was suitable for endovascular treatment or whether a surgical procedure was preferable. Results 223 cerebral aneurysms were identified in 203 of the 382 patients. The sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy of 16-slice CTA in detecting all aneurysms were 97.8%, 97.8%, and 97.8, respectively, on a per-aneurysm basis. There was no statistically significant difference in accuracy between 16-slice CTA and DSA. 136 aneurysms were suitable for endovascular coiling by using the 16-slice CTA images, and 132 aneurysms were success- fully treated by endovascular coiling. Forty-eight aneurysms were suitable for surgical clipping, and all aneurysms were deemed completely occluded during surgical clipping. Conclusion Sixteen-slice CTA is a highly accurate imaging examination for the diagnosis of cerebral aneurysms, and it can provide sufficient diagnostic information in guiding the treatment of aneurysms.

36A8o4eM.title: Cognitive development of normal school age children: a resting-state fMRI study]
36A8o4eM.abstract: To investigate the characteristics of cognitive development in elementary school children using rest-fMRI methods.Twenty-nine normal school children were divided into three groups according to their ages (8, 10 & 12 years old) and received the resting-state fMRI scans. A regional homogeneity (ReHo) approach was used to analyze blood oxygen level-dependent fMRI (BOLD-fMRI) data in resting state. The fMRI data were processed with software SPM2 and REST 1.2.Compared with younger groups (10 vs 8, 12 vs 10, 12 vs 8), the elder groups showed more increases in superior temporal gyrus (Z = 2.83, Z = 3.21), middle temporal gyrus (Z = 3.74, Z = 3.19, Z = 4.26), inferior temporal gyrus (Z = 3.01) and lentiform nucleus (Z = 3.31). In addition, the ReHo differences were demonstrated in superior frontal gyrus (Z = 3.21), middle frontal gyrus (Z = 3.19, Z = 3.22), medial frontal gyrus (Z = 3.15), lingual gyrus (Z = 3.43) and cerebellum (Z = 3.11, Z = 2.97) increased more in 12 years old group (12 vs 10, 12 vs 8). And the precuneus (Z = 2.95) and posterior cingulate (Z = 2.64) had increasing ReHo values with the age growth (12 vs 8).The function of execution control, accommodation of attention, visual spatial integration and default mode network became gradually developed with increasing age.

QiSuTWyO.title: The R_2~* Valuation in Assessing Preoperatively Histological Grade of CRCC: A Feasibility Study
QiSuTWyO.abstract: Objective To assess whether R2* values can be used to determine the nuclear grade of clear cell renal cell carcinomas(CRCC).Methods Blood oxygen level-dependent magnetic resonance imaging(BOLD-MRI) of 26 patients with pathologically-proven CRCCs was retrospectively assessed.R2* values were determined for the solid components of CRCC lesions.Histological nuclear grade was determined in each lesion.All patients were divided into low-and high-grade groups.R2* values were compared between different grades and between low-and high-grade groups.Receiver operating characteristic curves were drawn to establish the cut-off point for R2* values.The correlation between R2* value and pathological grade was assessed.Results Low-grade group(Grade Ⅰ+Ⅱ) contains 17 cases and high-grade group(Grade Ⅲ+Ⅳ) contains 9 cases.Significant difference was seen between different grade groups(P=0.001).R2* values of the high-grade group were higher than the low-grade group(P=0.003).A sensitivity of 78% and a specificity of 100% were achieved with a cut-off of 31.87 s-1.R2* values directly correlated with pathological grades(P=0.002).Conclusion R2* values of CRCCs could be employed as a non-invasive biomarker to help classifying the nuclear grade of CRCC.
keywords: Clear cell renal cell carcinoma Blood oxygen level-dependent imaging Magnetic resonance imagin Nuclear grade

m7K5fTxJ.title: Dixon Technique in Differentiating Lack-fat Renal Angiomyolipoma and Renal Cell Carcinoma
m7K5fTxJ.abstract: Purpose To explore the value of Dixon technique in differentiating lackfat renal angiomyolipoma(RAML) and renal cell carcinoma(RCC). Materials and Methods Dixon images of 16 patients with lack-fat RAML and 36 patients with RCC were analyzed, signal intensity of the tumor on the in-phase(IP), oppose-phase, fat-only(FO) and water-only(WO) images were measured, tumor signal intensity index(TSII)and tumor fat fraction(TFF) were calculated and compared, then receiver operating characteristic(ROC) curve was used to analyze. Results The accuracy, sensitivity and specifcity for diagnosing lack-fat RAML were 82.69%, 87.50% and 80.56%, respectively when using tumor signal intensity drop in OP images compared with IP images, and the corresponding FO images show higher signal intensity than the WO images. There was signifcant statistical difference of both TSII and TFF between lack-fat RAML and RCC(t=8.638, 11.179, P<0.05); area under the ROC curve using TSII for identifcation was 0.944, the accuracy, sensitivity and specificity were 86.54%, 93.75% and 83.33%,respectively for diagnosing lack-fat RAML; area under the ROC curve using TFF for identifcation was 0.986, the accuracy, sensitivity and specifcity were 94.23%, 93.75%and 94.44%, respectively for diagnosing lack-fat RAML. Conclusion Dixon technology,especially its capability of quantitative analysis, is signifcantly valuable to differentiate lack-fat RAML from RCC.

0KeC8dFe.title: The clinical diagnosis value of connective tissue diseases with lung interstitial disease causing pulmonary hypertension1 by HRCT
0KeC8dFe.abstract: Objective To investigate the clinical diagnosis value of pulmonary hypertension(PH) caused by connective tissue diseases(CTD) with lung interstitial disease by HRCT. Methods 60 patients were involved in this study and were all underwent HRCT, chest X-ray, and color Doppler ultrasound examinations. PH was diagnosed if pulmonary artery diameter was larger than 29 mm,or the ratios of pulmonary artery trunk and ascending aorta diameter was larger than 1 in axial HRCT scan. Using chi square test, PH diagnosed or not by HRCT was compared to those results with chest X-ray, and color Doppler ultrasound. Results There were 42 PH patients by HRCT,37patients by chest x-ray film and 44 patients by color Doppler ultrasound .It have good concordance (Kappa≥0.75),and there wasn't statistical difference (p>0.05). Conclusion For CTD patients, there is helpful for the diagnosis of PH using HRCT,and HRCT can provide lung interstitial changes at the same time.

h3A6zDNb.title: The value of MSCT in the diagnosis of the patients with untraumatic acute abdominal disease
h3A6zDNb.abstract: Objective: To discuss the value of multi-slice spiral CT(MSCT) in diagnosis of untraumatic acute abdominal disease.Methods: In 63 patients with acute abdominal disease diagnosed by clinic,their pre-operative results of MSCT,B-ultrasound and X-ray were analysed in contrast. Results: MSCT has a higher accuracy to diagnose the acute abdomen.The diagnostic accuracy was 90.4% in MSCT,(42.6%) in B-ultrasound,26.7% in X-ray.They had statistical difference(χ~2=231.04,P <0.01). Conclusion: MSCT had great significance in the causative diagnosis of untraumatic acute abdominal disease.It can provide timely,accurate and effective treatment to the patient with acute abdomen,and should be suggested as the first choice in diagnosis of acute abdomen.
